div.l: But yf he wold be slayn of Symkyn
Wyth pauade or wyth knyf or bodekyn
For Ielous folk ben parlous euermo
Algatis they wold her wyuys wenden so
And eke also for she was somdele smotirlich
She was as dygne as watyr in a dych
And ful of hocour and of bysmare
Here thoughte a lady shold here spare
What for hyr kynrede and hyr nortylrye
That she had lernyd in the Nonerye
A doughtyr hadde they betwyx hem two
Of twenty yeer wythoute ony mo
Sauynge a chyld that was of half yeer age
In cradyl it lay and was a proper page
Thys wenche thycke and wel y growe was
Wyth Camoys nose and eyen grey as glas
Buttokkis brode and brestis rounde and hye
But ryght fair was her heer I wyl not lye
The parson of the toun for she was feyr
In purpos was to make her hys heyr
Bothe of hys Catel and of hys mesuage
And straunge he made it of hyr mariage
His purpos was for to bestowe here hye
Vnto sum worthy blood of auncetrye
For holy chirche goodes muste be spendyd
On holy chirche blood that is descendyd
Therfore he wold his holy blood honoure
Though that he holy chirche shold deuoure
Gret sokyn hath this myller out of doute
Wyth whete and malt of al the lond aboute
And namely ther was a gret Colege
Men clepith it the soler halle at Cambrege
There was her whete ⁊ eke her malt y grounde
And on a day it happed in a stounde
Seek laye the mancipyl on a malady
Men wenden wysly that he shold dy
Fro whom this myller stale bothe mele ⁊ corn
An hundryd tyme more than he dyd beforn
